title: I hate the RNG of elemental drakes so much.
body:
I don't understand why we need this kind of RNG in the game. 3 infernal drakes is far more impactful than 3 ocean for example. 

It just seems like when I'm one the winning team we get, 1 ocean, two mountains, and a wind. 
When the enemy team is winning its like, "here guys heres 3 fire drakes in a row, enjoy the incontestable snow ball." 

I feel like the game would just be overall healthier if 1 of each drake spawned every game, even if the order was random.

I've been advocating for a while to have crit % build up an invisible meter on each target, with an attack that builds up over 100% resulting int he crit.

So if you have 30% crit, each hit adds 30, and on the fourth hit it's a critical strike. The remaining 20% spills over, so that it always results in 30% of attacks being a crit, but only at the latest possible instance

> [{quoted}](name=Shadowmender,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gihIpLWl,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2018-04-13T05:28:28.173+0000)
>
> It kinda does, except it's a build up on your own character. If you've got 20% crit, and your last 4 shots haven't crit, your next one is guaranteed to crit, iirc.

Not quite. The system has streak protection, meaning the actual CHANCE at a crit fluctuates based on your attacks thus far.

Starting at 20%, the first attack is actually less than 20% to crit, then it raises higher and higher.  It isn't guaranteed to crit on the fifth shot, but it is extremely likely to do so. On a crit it lowers back down, all hovering around the 20% range as a means of forcing an effective 20% instead of a true 20% which could result in lucky streaks of 3 or more crits in a row.

I don't mind the RNG. I think it makes things fun and interesting.

HOWEVER

I don't like the infernal drake. It feels super bad when behind because it makes a comeback feel significantly less possible than all of the other drakes. I love the drakes that give utility rather than stats.

The dragons are strange to me frankly. Riot hates invisible power, that's why Sona and aura items were basically destroyed or reworked. With the dragons you have a nebulous rng aura of stats that is difficult to account for.

Invisible power in combat is completely different than obvious movement speed or out of combat health regen though.

Sona, for example, gave 100 AD/AP teamwide for just existing after pressing Q. Nobody appreciated the effect, but it was useul. Having bonus movespeed to move to an objective faster than the enemy is obvious

The thing that I find bullshit about the RNG element of dragons, is the dragons that spawn are more or less useful to certain comps, but you cannot pick your comp around what dragons will spawn. If it were to at least tell you what dragons would spawn and in what order, there'd be a skill element to it.

Im not saying that the RNG of the dragons is hugely impactful, its just unnecessary to have one side get an advantage over the other for something they couldnt plan for.

Personally I enjoy the difference those drakes add. 

League is a lot like a board game in a sense. You put pieces down and they have specific roles in specific areas. The lanes are paths that they can travel, and the objective is to get to the end just like most board games. There are things in the game that allow you to advance your position rapidly to different areas, and gives you the ability to take objectives faster/better than an opponent based on how many you get. The difference between a flat gold drake and a bunch of varying ones gives you a huge variety of strategies to get to the goal and priority of the different objectives allows for changes in play style depending on what's going to spawn.

I'd like more things like that personally, more varying camps and etc to change how the game functions and allow even more variety. Or more objectives in general that if you get them or not changes other elements later on in the game. Maybe something that can set up what you want when it comes to the different dragons, like baiting certain (new) camps with something that changes what dragons spawn, etc.

Except that Mountain Drakes are entirely useless to a team that's losing since it gives you the power to siege objectives that you can't contest. Or it can actually be helpful for your team to rush Drake/Baron faster, if you really need to bring yourselves up from a huge deficit.

You can catch up in gold sure but for someone who controls a steady stream of gold through dragons, they're always going to be ahead while the enemy team HAS TO either get ahead in kills, objective taking and teamfight winning. That's impossible if you're sitting on a steady gold income. Older dragons made sure that the team who is ahead, stays ahead. Which is exactly why so many people have a problem with games of today - one person can get your team into the ground and since it's all team gold, it's very hard to come back from that if your entire team didn't feed anyone.

lol i had a game where we had 3 infernals and 2 mountains by taking them fast enough and it was a pretty disgusting power up then we got 2 elders for the memes, then baron  aced them and then surrendered for the BM. Good times good times

I agree that drakes should be tuned so that each is impactful.

I think that the infernal drake is a badly designed because it just gives flat out stats. Wind Drake IMO is a good drake because it encourages a roaming playstyle.

Ocean Drake should get a revamp, the sustain is not noticeable at all, especially since everybody has sustain out their asses anyway nowadays.

wouldn't say 3 inferno are much better than 3 ocean, as 3 ocean really allow you to outsustain you're opponents if you play it right.
The bigger issues is that ocean and wind are pretty poor unless you get multiple of them. A single wind or ocean has nearly no impact, while 3 wind allow you to run circles around you're opponents on the map and 3 oceans really make a differnce if both teams disengage after dropping low.
They also come with the issue that you need to play around them as a team to really get high value. If you have 3 oceans and you're team keeps going till they die instead of disengageing and abuseing the regen at some point, it has nearly no value. Inferno and mountain don't need any brain to use and even a single one of them is decently effective.

That beeing said, i think the impact of dragon rng is way lower than it feels for most players, and most games would not really go different if different dragons had spawned instead(exept maybe for a team not going for a dragon that they other wise did because they think wind isn't worth it, which is a psychological issue and not a balance one)
Dragon should just give gold again, I never liked the dragon buffs.

I feel like the problem lies not with the RNG, but how the Infernal Drake, and by some extent, the Mountain Drake, operated. They add direct, IMMEDIATE effects to the team. The Water and Wind drakes add more subtle, but just as powerful effects that influence the game in a slower way. 

I think that the Infernal and Mountain drakes NEED to have their bonuses modified. If they made Infernal scale in power based on the number of nearby allies, or slowly build to full like the new effect on Liandry, I think this would make it feel on par with Wind and Water. The same goes true with Mountain. I feel like it could use some kind of effect that builds to full potential, instead of always immediately being at full blast. I think something like this would make the RNG of 3 Infernals/Mountains feel just as impactful as the RNG of 3 Wind/Water.
